intro: Ottonia santa-ritana, commonly known as the Santa Rita ottonia, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
